But more importantly, she was connected to a case worker who helped her navigate SNAP benefits, find job training resources, and access healthcare support."}],["$","p",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-primary-blue","children":"Today, Maria has stable employment and regularly volunteers at our food distributions, giving back to the community that supported her family in crisis."}]]}]]}],["$","div",null,{"className":"bg-white rounded-3xl p-8 md:p-12 shadow-2xl","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"mb-6","children":["$","span",null,{"className":"inline-block px-4 py-2 bg-primary-blue/10 text-primary-blue font-semibold rounded-full text-sm mb-4","children":"Senior Story"}]}],["$","h3",null,{"className":"text-3xl font-heading font-bold text-gray-900 mb-4","children":"Mr. Johnson: Dignity in the Golden Years"}],["$","div",null,{"className":"space-y-4 text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":[["$","p",null,{"children":"At 78, Mr. Johnson lived alone on a fixed income. After paying for medication and utilities, he often had less than $50 a month for groceries. He was too proud to ask for help and too weak to travel far for food assistance."}],["$","p",null,{"children":"Our community outreach team learned about Mr. Johnson through a concerned neighbor. We began delivering fresh groceries to his door every week—not just dropping off food, but checking in, building relationship, and ensuring he had what he needed."}],["$","p",null,{"className":"font-semibold text-primary-blue","children":"Mr. Johnson now looks forward to his weekly visits, and he's gained weight and improved health.
